Section 1.title: Understanding Waves
Section 1.description: This section will introduce the basic concept of waves, explaining what they are and how they can be found in different mediums.

Section 2.title: Key Wave Properties
Section 2.description: We will explore the fundamental properties of waves, including frequency, wavelength, and amplitude, and why these characteristics are significant.

Section 3.title: Types of Waves
Section 3.description: This section will differentiate between mechanical and electromagnetic waves and provide examples of each to illustrate their differences.

Section 4.title: Wave Behavior
Section 4.description: We will delve into how waves interact with each other and their surroundings, including concepts such as reflection, refraction, and diffraction.

Section 5.title: Simple Harmonic Motion
Section 5.description: This section will introduce oscillations and simple harmonic motion, explaining how they relate to waves and providing real-world examples.

Section 6.title: Mathematics of Waves
Section 6.description: Here, we will introduce basic equations that describe wave properties and motions to help students understand how calculations can be performed.

Section 7.title: Wave-Particle Duality
Section 7.description: We will discuss the concept of wave-particle duality and its historical significance in quantum mechanics, setting the stage for deeper exploration into the topic.

Section 8.title: Applications of Waves
Section 8.description: This section will examine practical applications of wave concepts in technology and nature, highlighting the relevance of understanding wave properties.

Section 9.title: Review and Conceptual Understanding
Section 9.description: We will summarize key concepts learned throughout the chapters and engage in discussions to ensure a solid understanding of waves and oscillations.
